messages.title: Global Warming? What Global Warming?
messages.content: The hottest year in recent history was probably 1998, according to official data. We have just had our wettest winter for 31 years. There are many scientists who do not agree that there is a link between carbon dioxide emissions and global warming. In the past the Earth has been hotter than it is now, and there are natural cycles. Cars in particular do not cause that much carbon dioxide emissions, certainly not enough to change our lifestyle – Vote UKIP!

messages.title: The true cost of being in the European Union
messages.content: A brand new European satellite navigation system so that they can tax our road usage. In addition to the existing U.S. GPS & Russian Glonass)

messages.title: Send them a message:
messages.content: A vote for UKIP is not a wasted vote because a traditional party government whatever colour will result in more rule from the EU. Every vote sends a message and encourages others to do the same.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Leave the EU and save £45m a day (and rising) to Brussels
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposes leaving the EU to save money directed to Brussels.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Bring the power to make laws back to Westminster
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Aims to return legislative power fully to the UK parliament.
Advocates for strict enforcement of laws.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Public spending: Cut the quangos in half, save £18 billion a year
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposes to reduce the number of quangos to save public funds.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Support our armed forces personnel, increase budgets by 40%
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to increase defense spending and support for armed forces.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Charge foreign lorries for using British roads
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Intends to impose charges on foreign lorries utilizing British roads.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Simplify benefits & taxes to eliminate poverty traps
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Aims to simplify the benefits and tax systems to prevent poverty.

issues.brexitEurope: Leave the EU and save £45m a day (and rising) to Brussels. Bring the power to make laws back to Westminster.
issues.economy: Public spending: Cut the quangos in half, save £18 billion a year. Simplify benefits & taxes to eliminate poverty traps.
issues.governance: With the implementation of the EU Constitution Treaty, the EU now has power over almost every area of our lives. Where is our referendum?
issues.socialWelfare: Simplify benefits & taxes to eliminate poverty traps.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have worked and lived in Swindon for 14 years as an electronic engineer. I am a trustee of 'The Filling Station', a charity that helps homeless and hard-up people. I am also a church deacon, and I like to do home improvements. I joined UKIP because we are losing control of our country to a European Supersstate managed by bureaucrats of little credit. I will work hard for the residents of South Swindon.

quotes.text: With the implementation of the EU Constitution Treaty, the EU now has power over almost every area of our lives. Where is our referendum?
The project of our founding fathers is complete: the economic union is becoming a political union
It is not as though this is being imposed on our country. People will have the chance to put their views.
